practitioner_domains.domain_description: Clinical cancer treatment and management of solid tumors
practitioner_domains.specialization_notes: Half of clinical time focused on actual cancer treatment, subspecialty interest in breast cancer

practitioner_domains.domain_description: Opportunities to catch cancer early across all solid tumor types
practitioner_domains.specialization_notes: Blood work, imaging, physical assessments and surveys for catching disease early

practitioner_domains.domain_description: Genetic risk assessment and inherited cancer risk evaluation
practitioner_domains.specialization_notes: Cancer genetics expertise, chairs high-risk breast cancer program

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Assessment of lifetime and 10-year risk of developing breast cancer
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: Genetic cancer risk assessment survey, imaging, blood work, physical exam

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Tissue density categorization (A, B, C, D) affecting cancer detection and risk
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: Mammogram assessment with automated density categorization software

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Cancer incidence by age and type in up to third degree relatives
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: Comprehensive pedigree analysis for inherited cancer risk

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Assessment of whether mammogram captured all breast tissue with adequate positioning
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: Third-party software analysis of image acquisition quality

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Sleep as part of lifestyle medicine pillars affecting cancer risk
Height and weight calculation used in breast cancer risk assessment
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: Component of Tyrer-Cuzick risk calculation model

assessments.assessment_description: A questionnaire that identifies personal and family history factors to calculate lifetime and 10-year breast cancer risk using established models like Tyrer-Cusk and Gail calculators

technology_vendor.name: Multiple vendors including Famgenics, Vulpara CRA Health, Cancer IQ, Ambry CARE platform
technology_vendor.specific_equipment: Mobile phone or computer with internet access

preparation_steps: Send survey link 5 days before appointment
Ensure patient has access to family medical history
Gather previous breast biopsy results if applicable
common_mistakes: Inaccurate answers due to lack of understanding

metrics.reference_ranges: Less than 15% (average risk), 15-20% (intermediate risk), Greater than 20% (high risk)
metrics.validity_confidence: Low - flawed due to lifetime timeframe not matching clinical decision needs
metrics.reliability_confidence: Moderate - depends heavily on accurate patient reporting

metrics.reference_ranges: Greater than 1.66% per year qualifies for chemoprevention
metrics.validity_confidence: Moderate - better timeframe but still limited
metrics.reliability_confidence: Moderate - depends on accurate patient data

metrics.reference_ranges: Qualifies or does not qualify based on NCCN guidelines
metrics.reliability_confidence: Moderate - depends on accurate family history

state_influences.state_name: Patient engagement in breast imaging workflow
state_influences.impact_on_assessment: Only about 50% complete survey before appointment
state_influences.impact_on_interpretation: Incomplete data leads to less accurate risk assessment

state_influences.impact_on_assessment: Many patients lack detailed family history information
state_influences.impact_on_interpretation: Incomplete family history can underestimate genetic risk

assets_generated.description: Clinician dashboard showing calculated risk scores and recommendations for further screening

assessments.assessment_description: X-ray imaging of the breast to detect abnormal patterns, distortions, or lesions using 2D or 3D technology with AI-assisted detection

technology_vendor.name: Hologic, Siemens, GE, Fuji
technology_vendor.specific_equipment: Mammography X-ray units with tomosynthesis capability

coaching_cues: Ensure adequate compression for quality image
common_mistakes: Poor positioning leading to low quality images

metrics.reference_ranges: Positive requires diagnostic workup, Negative allows routine screening
A,B (non-dense) - routine screening; C,D (dense) - supplemental ultrasound recommended
metrics.reliability_confidence: High - automated software with radiologist verification

state_influences.impact_on_assessment: Larger breasts harder to position consistently
state_influences.impact_on_interpretation: May affect image quality and tissue capture completeness
Postmenopausal women typically have less dense breasts, easier to interpret

assets_generated.description: Detailed report including AI findings, density assessment, and recommendations
Summary of results and recommendations sent to patient

assessments.assessment_description: Supplemental imaging used for women with dense breast tissue or intermediate risk to detect cancers that mammography might miss

preparation_steps: Confirm breast density category C or D
coaching_cues: Focus on areas not well visualized on mammogram
common_mistakes: Missing small lesions in dense tissue

metrics.reference_ranges: Any suspicious lesions require further evaluation
metrics.validity_confidence: High - excellent for dense breast tissue
metrics.reliability_confidence: High - operator dependent but reliable when properly performed

state_influences.impact_on_assessment: Most effective in dense breast tissue
state_influences.impact_on_interpretation: Higher yield in category C and D density

assets_generated.description: Documentation of findings and recommendations for further action if needed

assessments.assessment_description: High-resolution imaging recommended for high-risk women (>20% lifetime risk) to detect early cancers with superior sensitivity

preparation_steps: Schedule for specific menstrual cycle timing
coaching_cues: Patient must remain still during scan

metrics.reference_ranges: Any enhancing lesions require correlation or biopsy
metrics.validity_confidence: Very High - highest sensitivity for breast cancer detection
metrics.reliability_confidence: High - consistent results when properly performed

state_influences.impact_on_assessment: Background enhancement varies with hormonal status

assets_generated.description: Detailed analysis of enhancement patterns and recommendations

assessments.assessment_description: DNA analysis to identify hereditary cancer risk mutations, particularly BRCA1, BRCA2, and other cancer predisposition genes

technology_vendor.name: Myriad Genetics, Ambry Genetics
technology_vendor.specific_equipment: Blood draw or saliva collection kit

coaching_cues: Explain implications of positive and negative results
common_mistakes: Not understanding variant of uncertain significance results

metrics.reference_ranges: Positive mutations require enhanced screening protocols

state_influences.impact_on_interpretation: Incomplete family history may miss important patterns

assets_generated.description: Detailed analysis of tested genes with interpretation and recommendations

interventions.intervention_description: Tailored imaging cadence based on individual breast cancer risk assessment including 3D mammography, ultrasound, and MRI at specific intervals
interventions.purpose: Early detection of breast cancer in high-risk individuals through personalized screening schedules

protocols.duration: Ongoing annual screening with risk-stratified intervals
protocols.frequency: Annual 3D mammography for all; 6-month MRI for >20% Tyrer-Cuzick risk; whole breast ultrasound for dense breasts (Category C/D) and intermediate risk (15-20%)
protocols.volume: Multiple imaging modalities per individual risk profile
progression_criteria: Breast density Category C or D
protocols.reassessment_intervals: Annual risk reassessment with imaging results

constraints_accommodations.accommodation_strategy: Risk score documentation >20% to qualify for MRI coverage
Automated scheduling systems and patient education materials

resource_requirements.time: 2-4 hours per screening cycle depending on modalities required
resource_requirements.equipment: 3D mammography machines (Hologic, Siemens, GE, Fuji), ultrasound equipment, MRI machines, AI-assisted detection software
resource_requirements.staff_expertise: Certified mammography technicians, radiologists trained in breast imaging, genetic counselors

interventions.intervention_description: Anti-estrogen medication prescribed for high-risk women to reduce breast cancer incidence by 50%
interventions.purpose: Primary prevention of breast cancer in women with elevated risk based on Gail model assessment

protocols.reassessment_intervals: Regular monitoring for side effects and continued risk assessment

constraints_accommodations.accommodation_strategy: Comprehensive medical evaluation and risk-benefit analysis before initiation
Patient education and regular follow-up appointments

resource_requirements.time: Initial consultation 1-2 hours, follow-up visits 30 minutes quarterly
resource_requirements.staff_expertise: Oncologist or physician trained in chemoprevention protocols

interventions.intervention_description: DNA analysis for hereditary cancer mutations with genetic counseling for risk interpretation and family cascade testing
interventions.purpose: Identify inherited cancer susceptibility and guide personalized screening and prevention strategies

protocols.duration: One-time testing with ongoing genetic counseling as needed
protocols.frequency: Single blood or saliva collection, multiple counseling sessions
protocols.volume: Full genetic analysis with professional interpretation
protocols.reassessment_intervals: Results review and family cascade testing coordination

constraints_accommodations.accommodation_strategy: NCCN criteria documentation for coverage approval, $250 out-of-pocket option
Genetic counselor-guided family outreach and education

resource_requirements.time: Initial counseling 1-2 hours, results discussion 1 hour, family counseling variable
resource_requirements.equipment: DNA collection kits, laboratory processing facilities
resource_requirements.staff_expertise: Certified genetic counselors, medical geneticists, oncologists

interventions.intervention_name: Lifestyle Medicine Program for Cancer Risk Reduction
interventions.intervention_description: Comprehensive lifestyle modification program targeting nutrition, exercise, sleep, stress management, and substance use to reduce cancer risk
interventions.purpose: Modify modifiable risk factors to reduce breast cancer risk and improve overall health outcomes

protocols.duration: Ongoing lifestyle changes with structured 6-12 month initial program
protocols.frequency: Daily lifestyle practices with weekly to monthly coaching sessions
protocols.intensity: Personalized based on individual assessment and capabilities
protocols.volume: Multi-pillar approach addressing all lifestyle medicine domains
protocols.reassessment_intervals: Monthly progress reviews with quarterly comprehensive reassessment

constraints_accommodations.accommodation_strategy: Personalized 'one size fits one' approach rather than standardized protocols
Regular coaching support and flexible program modifications

resource_requirements.time: Initial assessment 2-3 hours, weekly sessions 1 hour, daily self-management variable
resource_requirements.equipment: Body composition analysis tools, fitness equipment, sleep monitoring devices
resource_requirements.staff_expertise: Lifestyle medicine physicians, nutritionists, exercise physiologists, sleep specialists, behavioral coaches

interventions.intervention_description: Structured education program to help patients understand their cancer risk assessment results and appropriate actions
interventions.purpose: Empower patients with knowledge about their cancer risk and available options for risk reduction and early detection

protocols.duration: Initial education session with ongoing reinforcement
protocols.frequency: Initial comprehensive session followed by periodic updates
protocols.intensity: Personalized based on individual risk level and learning needs
protocols.volume: Multi-modal education including written materials, digital resources, and counseling
protocols.reassessment_intervals: Annual education updates with risk reassessment

constraints_accommodations.accommodation_strategy: Multi-modal educational materials adapted to individual comprehension levels

resource_requirements.time: Initial session 1-2 hours, follow-up sessions 30-60 minutes
resource_requirements.equipment: Educational materials, digital platforms, assessment tools
resource_requirements.staff_expertise: Genetic counselors, patient educators, oncology nurses, physicians

processed_files.file_name: Ontology Knowledge Gathering Interview - Mollie – 2025_07_24 17_13 BST – Notes by Gemini.txt

practitioner_domains.domain_description: Encompasses six areas: nutrition, physical activity, sleep, stress reduction/management, substance use reduction, and positive social connection. Leverages these elements to prevent disease and treat existing conditions.
practitioner_domains.specialization_notes: Primary area of expertise and focus, used as foundation for optimal health and functioning

practitioner_domains.domain_description: Refers to the spectrum of insulin resistance from normal glycemic control to impaired glucose tolerance, pre-diabetes, frank type 2 diabetes, and end-stage type 2 diabetes requiring exogenous insulin administration.
practitioner_domains.specialization_notes: Also referred to as metabolic health; specific focus area within broader practice

practitioner_domains.domain_description: Includes hypertension, dyslipidemia, diabetes, overweight, and obesity management.
practitioner_domains.specialization_notes: Most commonly treated conditions due to prevalence; filters into mood disorders and chronic pain

practitioner_domains.domain_description: Experience in hospital and outpatient settings treating conditions with conventional western medicine approaches.
practitioner_domains.specialization_notes: Blends conventional western medicine with lifestyle medicine using evidence-based protocols

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Blood test measuring glycated red blood cells over three months; reference ranges: <5.7 normal, 5.7-6.4 pre-diabetes, ≥6.5 diabetes
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: Primary blood glucose assessment tool, lagging indicator of insulin resistance

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Blood glucose measurement after fasting period
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: Conventional western medicine assessment for glucose management

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Insulin measurement after fasting period, used with fasting glucose for HOMA-IR calculation
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: Can detect earlier insulin resistance than A1C; moderate resource assessment

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Calculated from height and weight measurements
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: Low resource anthropometric assessment; lowest confidence among body composition measures

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Measurement at appropriate body landmarks using tape measure
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: Body composition assessment with gender, race, and ethnicity-specific reference ranges

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Imaging study providing body fat percentage and lean mass data
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: Gold standard for body composition; highest confidence level for body composition assessment

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Assessed through subjective reporting of feeling well-rested upon waking and sleep questionnaires
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: One of four high-priority pillars for blood glucose management

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Number of hours sleeping on regular basis, weekdays and weekends; target 7-9 hours for general adult population
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: Assessed through wearables and subjective reporting

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Minutes per week of light, moderate, and vigorous intensity activity; reference: 150 min/week moderate or 75 min/week vigorous plus 2 days strength training
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: Assessed using IPAQ questionnaire and wearables; follows Physical Activity Guidelines for Americans

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Assessed as demands on person exceeding their resources to manage those demands
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: Measured using PSS4 tool; lowest confidence assessment due to subjective nature

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Assessed through 24-hour dietary recalls, eating patterns, food preferences, and preparation methods
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: One of four high-priority pillars for blood glucose management; uses various food logging tools

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Understanding of person's weight trajectory, highest/lowest weights, previous interventions, and relationship with weight
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: Critical for interpreting body composition results and providing appropriate interventions

interventions.intervention_description: Comprehensive assessment protocol combining conventional western medicine blood work with six pillars of lifestyle medicine evaluation (nutrition, physical activity, sleep, stress, substance use reduction, positive social connection) to assess and manage blood glucose management and metabolic health
interventions.purpose: To assess insulin resistance spectrum from normal glycemic control to type 2 diabetes and optimize lifestyle factors for disease prevention and treatment

protocols.frequency: Initial assessment followed by regular monitoring intervals
protocols.volume: Full medical history, lab work, and detailed lifestyle pillar interviews
progression_criteria: Achievement of physical activity guidelines (150 min moderate intensity weekly)
protocols.reassessment_intervals: A1C monitored every 3-6 months, lifestyle factors assessed at each visit

constraints_accommodations.accommodation_strategy: Use basic measurements (weight, BMI, A1C, waist circumference) and lifestyle assessment questionnaire
Add fasting insulin, DEXA scan, and structured lifestyle pillar interviews
Include oral glucose tolerance test and comprehensive wearable device monitoring

constraints_accommodations.constraint_type: Medical conditions affecting red blood cells
constraints_accommodations.accommodation_strategy: Consider hemoglobinopathies, iron deficiency, sickle cell when interpreting A1C results
Account for oral steroids, mental health medications, chronic pain medications affecting glucose and weight

resource_requirements.time: 2-3 hours for comprehensive initial assessment including potential oral glucose tolerance test
resource_requirements.equipment: Basic: scale, tape measure, blood draw supplies. Advanced: DEXA scanner, wearable devices (Oura Ring), CGM (Stilo), food logging apps
resource_requirements.staff_expertise: Lifestyle medicine practitioner with expertise in metabolic health, chronic disease management, and conventional western medicine
resource_requirements.cost_level: Low to High depending on resource level - basic labs and measurements are low cost, DEXA and comprehensive testing moderate to high cost
